p: line 338-344: PB1F2 was shown to be heavily ubiquitinated, H7PB1f2 also contains the C-terminal lysine cluster shown to be responsible for H5 and H1 PB1f2 expression level https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0118477. If H7PB1f2 does not interact with MAVS, authors should investigate if PB1f2 ubiquitination could contribute to MAVS ubiquitination by TRIM31
